candidates.title: feat: simplify requests to avoid immediate await?
feat: type-safe setting of API version on RequestBuilder
refactor: replace request and stream functions with a custom builder
feat: update reqwest to 0.11 and tokio to 1.0
fix: repair and gate on the support for no-default-features
chore: refactor config.rs and its tests
feat: Add support for clouds-public.yaml and secure.yaml.
candidates.body:
Before this change, only clouds.yaml was supported when getting a session
via `from_config`.

This change introduces support for clouds-public.yaml and secure.yaml.

It was not trivial to use serde_derive to parse the files individually
as all 3 files may contain all or none of the configuration, as long as
the merged result is valid configuration.
So the strategy here was to parse the 3 files into serde_yaml::Value
structs and merge them, and then convert them to the serde_derive
structs.

candidates.title: Use rustls instead of native-tls to avoid non-Rust dependencies
chore: migrate to protocol code from osproto

chosen_pr.title: feat: Add support for clouds-public.yaml and secure.yaml.
chosen_pr.body:
Before this change, only clouds.yaml was supported when getting a session
via `from_config`.

This change introduces support for clouds-public.yaml and secure.yaml.

It was not trivial to use serde_derive to parse the files individually
as all 3 files may contain all or none of the configuration, as long as
the merged result is valid configuration.
So the strategy here was to parse the 3 files into serde_yaml::Value
structs and merge them, and then convert them to the serde_derive
structs.

chosen_detail.title: feat: Add support for clouds-public.yaml and secure.yaml.
chosen_detail.body:
Before this change, only clouds.yaml was supported when getting a session

So the strategy here was to parse the 3 files into serde_yaml::Value

repo.name: rust-osauth
repo.description: Asynchronous OpenStack session and authentication for Rust
